title: The Traitors fashion explained: Knitwear, jumpsuits and Cluedo
description: It's not just what they say or how they act that influences their fellow contestants - it's how they dress, too.
content:
Crime writer Harriet was not fully convinced that Rachel was a Traitor - until she saw her wear a red dress the day after a pivotal moment in the show.
"She'd gone in looking so sleek and professional… whereas before, she was dressed up more in child... [6112 chars]

title: 'We knew the truth': How parents uncovered Scottish hospital's infected water scandal
description: Dozens of patients became more unwell and some died with infections picked up at Glasgow's Queen Elizabeth University Hospital.
content:
For years they felt stonewalled, lied to and gaslit. Now they're angry.
Karen Stirrat and Charmaine Lacock are mothers of children they say were exposed to infections while being treated for cancer at Glasgow's flagship "super hospital".
They were so... [8691 chars]

title: As we return to a pre-WW2 order, the middle powers face a challenge
description: With economic stagnation and extremes of inequality comes corrosion of trust in democratic institutions. So Trump may be a symptom, not a cause, of what Carney called a "rupture" with the post-WW2 order

title: ‘I feel like I’ll never be cold again’: How tennis stars coped with Melbourne heat
description: Extreme heat wreaked havoc on Saturday’s Australian Open schedule but tennis has changed its ways of dealing with the sun
